entry.title: Init 5: How it all Started
entry.content:
Whoami

Hi, My name is Waseem Akram a.k.a n0nu11. I make web apps, mobile apps, hunt bugs, and design a little bit of user interfaces. Well, I‚Äôm here to share with you the wonderful but boring story of mine on how I got introduced to programming and making stuffs I like and much more. So get ready with the time machine, because we are going to travel back and forth to important moments in time. Let us go way back in time.

Journey to the center of my childhood

I‚Äôve been a computer enthusiast since my childhood. I like to play and break computers, explore the unknown realm of the computer world. Since then I‚Äôve been curious how these magic boxes (computers) works. But a bummer, all I had is a mediocre desktop with limited and bad internet connection (Internet wasn‚Äôt that famous those days). I started learning how basic components like printers, scanners, modems, etc,. works. Also, I broke a lot of things from software (Operating systems by misconfiguration) to hardware in the way of exploration. Thanks to my dad for getting it fixed every time.

Nothing interesting here. let us go a little forward in time now.

Geek! Not Nerd!!

We‚Äôre here in 2012. I‚Äôm now a 13-year-old calling myself a geek üòÜ, because that was the time I owned my first android phone, an old little Micromax touch phone. I‚Äôve used phones before, obviously an android but that belongs to my parents so I didn‚Äôt have much freedom to explore and break things. When I got my phone, things started getting rigor. I‚Äôve learned a lot about android, iPhones, their models, and specs. I started tweaking around the android and installing various launchers to customize it the way I want. One fine day, I got introduced to rooting and you would‚Äôve expect it. I Rooted my phone ignoring those scary warnings about the security issues and bricking problems. Since then it changed the way I look at technology, How manufactures restrict users, and how rooting breaks out the restriction and allows freedom to customize it in kernel level. Also that was the first time I got introduced to the term Hacking. I installed a lot of tweaks, apps, and patched games, etc, I pretty much enjoyed the process of rooting, the thrill of rooting (because if I brick, all I had to do is throw it away or spend some lump money to fix which will never be an option for me) and the benefits I gained after rooting. Apart from geeky stuffs I did Photoshop, Video editing using nero vision.

Lets leave. come on get in the time machine‚Ä¶

The Siri tragic

Huh! It is 2014. I‚Äôm 15 now, usual studies and exams bored me as always. One fine day, My dad bought me an iPhone 4, that‚Äôs the first iPhone I had. That small incredible device is a masterpiece (Thanks to Steve jobs). The speed, smoothness, and camera quality blew my mind. I loved every moment with it. Well time passed, you would‚Äôve guessed it by now, ITS TIME TO JAILBREAK!!! (Jailbreak is similar to rooting). Again I started enjoying the benefits and freedom of tweaking.

  • There wasn‚Äôt a Bluetooth file transfer feature in the iPhone. Installed a tweak, Got it.

  • No file manager? no problem.

  • Need some points or money in games? no problem.

  • Download movies and music directly to iTunes? no problem.

Jailbreak was like a buff for iPhone. Features were not just an imagination on those days. Then I got to know about SIRI. Who didn‚Äôt want a talking smart assistant on their phone? But Siri wasn‚Äôt natively available for iPhone 4. well let us install the SIRI using cydia (its a package manager where you can install jailbreak tweaks) then. Let me risk it, what could go wrong right? fingers crossed ü§û.

Something went wrong with installation or dependencies I think, or it wasn‚Äôt just built for the iPhone 4.

My incredible iPhone got bricked üò≠

This is one of the most regretting moments in my life.

I could have just fixed it by formatting everything back to normal but the internet was expensive those days and the firmware files were more than a gig in size. No problem lets fix it.

I bought the internet pack and started downloading firmware files. Fingers crossed again ü§û.

99% and FAILED!!!

I can‚Äôt afford another data pack. so I just gave up. Bye Bye iPhone üò¢

Sad times. let us get going‚Ä¶

The Game of Roms

Its Year 2014, 16-year-old playing with android. Yeah I‚Äôm back to android after I messed up my iPhone. since then I had many android phones changed but in every android phone that I ever owned I did the same thing which is far from rooting. This time I started playing with the Android roms (Android ROMs are just modified android os) and different kernels, bootloaders, recovery images,etc., available for the specific device I had. I would change the android rom as frequently as 2-3 per week just because it is fun to do. Basically, I was addicted to that for a long time. I didn‚Äôt want to stay there but I wanted to learn how the operating system works. That‚Äôs how I got introduced to Linux. I was a beginner and a windows user, so Linux is scary as well as fun for the first time. Out of curiosity i learned Bash Scripting and made Intelli Tweaks.

Click here to check it out

Intelli tweaks is, as the name suggests, Its tweaking script for rooted android phones which will buff your phone‚Äôs performance; You may have to take a look at what it can do and make sure you read the comments too üòÖ. To be honest, I copied a few features from others and added to mine and made my tweaks look unique.

Thats the first-ever code/project I ever wrote. Proud Moment üéâ.

I didn‚Äôt know what coding/programming or programming languages was back then. I was just doing everything out of curiosity by reading others works and guides online.

Sometime back then I also learned Ethical Hacking. Basic XSS, SQL Injections, Directory path traversals, and a quite few. One day an old Indian website caught my eye with an admin login page. Well my curiosity didn‚Äôt stop me to apply SQL injection and the next minute I was inside the website‚Äôs admin panel. So creepy and Scary. while I was looking around I accidentally clicked something that made the whole website go nuts and turn off. I didn‚Äôt wanna do anything but to come out of it. The second day I found that it is fixed. Turned out the first website I hacked. Another Proud Moment üéâ.

Whatever! Its time!. Let us jump a year

Oh wait, I was able to C

We‚Äôre in 2015, the year where it all started. I was a a biology student in my highschool. Why? coz I actually chose biology over computer science because I thought choosing CS will bore me and also I love biology. One day our biology teacher was on leave so we stayed back in the computer science class. That day was the quiz day for the CS class. I was sitting behind in the corner and answering almost all the questions correctly. CS teacher complimented me in front of the whole class and asked me ‚Äù How are you able to answer all those questions? ‚Äú (Honestly those were basic questions not rocket science). I answered ‚ÄúIts basics and I feel computer science is too easy ‚Äú.

One guy out of rage üò§ came to me and made a dare asking me to compile a C program, ‚Äù I‚Äôm not asking you to run but just successfully compile a c program ‚Äú were his words.

I took it seriously and couldn‚Äôt forget it. I went home from school. Took my laptop started searching what the heck is C programming anyway? (Honestly, I had no idea what is programming and programming languages are until that day).

Okay it is interesting, we can make computers do things whatever we want. It‚Äôs basically a superpower! let‚Äôs learn then?

I borrowed an old C programming book from a friend (the Internet wasn‚Äôt a choice still). I started learning and wrote my first ever Hello World program.

#include<stdio.h>

int main(){
    printf("Hello Waseem!");
    return 0;
}

What? I made computer talk? Wow cool

That was an easy program. I mean the easiest program ever. So I didn‚Äôt have any problem until I started digging into it more. The more I learned the more I got warnings and errors.

But going through the book again with what I‚Äôve learned clearly helped me solve all those problems. It‚Äôs just the compiler is expecting me to write code that it can understand, not some gibberish like missing a semicolon or syntax errors.

so sweet of you compiler.

I was so curious. I learned variables, various data types, conditionals, loopings. But something stopped me progressing and that‚Äôs Functions, Structs and Pointers.

I asked myself ‚ÄúWhat the heck is Functions? Structures? Pointers?‚Äù.

I was tired understanding those and honestly I couldn‚Äôt. So I gave up hoping one day I could be able to understand those.

Back to time machine

The Comeback

It is early 2016 now. I‚Äôm on summer vacations after those long hectic board exams. Bored and got nothing to do except playing games. One day I‚Äôve decided to join some institutions that can teach me C programming. That‚Äôs how I joined NIIT (National Institute of Information Technology) and opted for C, C++, Data Structures, and Java course ( bad for wallet obviously but it turned out to be the best decision of my life ).

I was able to learn Functions, Structures, and many more finally. Also this was my first ever biggest dumb program I wrote. It just finds the repeated character in a word that you enter.

Alert: Its 150+ lines long, you may have to scroll fast.

I was happy that I could write my own programs now. And I didn‚Äôt stop there. I completed learning C with all those things that I wasn‚Äôt able to understand in the past. I eventually moved to C++ where I learned OOPS (Object-Oriented Software Programming). Classes, Objects, Encapsulation, Abstraction, Polymorphism, and all other was so much fun learning. I made sure I didn‚Äôt stop learning and making things. Sometime later I moved to data structures, where I learned all those basic data structures form stacks, queues to trees, and heaps.

Dawn of the planet of the Apps

It‚Äôs Mid 2016, Passed C, C++, Data structures exams and moved on to Java Class. But a bummer there, Only one Java class per week. So I have to wait for a week to learn something new. Dammit!. I didn‚Äôt have patience so I started learning Java on my own. Java was as fun as C and C++ because all the basic core concepts were the same, Syntax is different (Many other factors too but I‚Äôm simplifying here). Java classes bored me because I learned the concepts beforehand that they teach in class. I kept exploring, coding stuffs‚Ä¶

This is one of a early programs I wrote and I am proud of Click here to take a look

One fine day, I got a million-dollar question in my mind:

‚ÄúWhy am I learning all this? What can I potentially make something better out of this?‚Äù

That‚Äôs when I really want to make use of my coding skill and started Googling. I found out I can make Android Apps since I know Java. Wait no more‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

I started learning Android Programming in Udacity and I gradually started making little basic android apps.

I Moved to College a few months later. I always had a mind for solving problems. I saw a problem with timetables because it is new for me. wait no more I made a Time Table App that can not only show you what period is right now but also remind you what‚Äôs next. Don‚Äôt mind the name please üòÖ.

Click here to take a look

That was my first successful android project üéâ

Since then, I was always curious to learn the concepts in depth be as it android or any programming languages.

A few months later, a Hackathon was conducted in my college where I created an app for our college bus which will update live status and route of the bus and also alert the students when the bus is near 100-300 meters.

(Unfortunately I lost the code, so I can‚Äôt able to link it here)

I‚Äôve made a lot of apps since then, met a lot of people, made friends, helped a lot of people, made some money too ü§ë.

In 2017, I bought a Macbook Pro 2012, until then I used an old dell laptop with 2 gigs of ram. Imagine running an android studio in an < 2 Gb RAM. Its a nightmare.

The same year, I found a basic thing that WhatsApp is missing. That is a video cutting features. I see a lot of people want to upload videos or songs that are more than 30 seconds but unfortunately there isn‚Äôt a way unless they have to use a hard way by cutting the videos 30 seconds manually and upload the video as their stories in Whatsapp. Also there is no such app that can do it in the market.

I found that as an opportunity and made Klip Kutter. You would‚Äôve guessed it by now. The App that can cut the videos into 30 seconds chunks which can make your life easy.

click here to take a look

Its an instant hit from day 1, I was the first in the market. After a week many apps copied the same functionality and started to pop in the play store.

Then I got introduced to iOS App Development and learned Swift programming language. Honestly Swift is a breeze and beautiful. Swift is the second most language I love.

The first iOS app I made was Venturious. It wasn‚Äôt my idea but a good friend/senior of mine Haashir.

Second, I created Facepass, both for android and iOS. It is basically an app for anonymous messaging but powered with Facial Recognition.

Producthunt: https://www.producthunt.com/posts/facepass
Github: https://github.com/devwaseem/FacePass

Later, the same year. I was hired by a company called Veda and assigned to make an iOS app for Learn America LMS.

Fast Forward

It‚Äôs 2018, I learned Kotlin which is a programming language made for Android Apps. Kotlin is similar to Swift but unique in its own way. I love Coding using it. With that, I decided to make an app. I eventually landed making an App for our college. Its a note keeper app which will provide notes for your class if someone already uploaded. The app was powered by a Chatbot that I made. It was uploaded to play store initially but recently I removed it because I wasn‚Äôt getting a lot of users.

I also started learning Web Technologies the same year. I learned Nodejs, React, Angular, Vuejs, and made a lot of web apps for myself and my clients while I was providing freelancing service. you can take a look at my instagram for more stuffs.

Some of the Web apps are:

This is the website I‚Äôve created for my college‚Äôs workshop event.

In 2019, I created my portfolio website for freelancing.

Link: devwaseem.github.io

Later the same year and early 2019, I was also started learning and designing UI (User interface).

These are some of the designs

Phewww.. Feeling tired after a long journey? let‚Äôs go back to 2020 finally üòâ.

Present and Infinity

It‚Äôs the year 2020, finally. This year I started learning Ethical Hacking again. Why? you ask. I know I am good at programming at the same time I love learning in-depth and exploring how internals works. The term Hacking isn‚Äôt what I perceive as some guy doing bad things but as the guy who enjoys breaking and learning stuffs in depth. Basically I want to be a security researcher coz I love providing security and breaking it. Even my college final year project is based on the security field. I‚Äôve loved breaking stuff and learning things in-depth as you could‚Äôve known by now if you read all the above sections.

I‚Äôm currently learning and breaking stuffs in a safe way with various labs and platforms. One of the platforms is tryhackme which provides a lab setup to learn and break systems.


I‚Äôve also made a simple script called AnonymousBash. Which as the name suggests, it will proxy all your bash commands by tunneling it through the TOR network.

Link: https://github.com/devwaseem/AnonymousBash

I also play Capture the Flag, which is a game for hackers or any cybersecurity enthusiast.

I‚Äôve started this blog because I want to seed back the knowledge to the community. I‚Äôll post or share my writeups, research, walkthroughs, tips & tricks, and much more‚Ä¶

I think that‚Äôs it for now‚Ä¶

F.A.Q

I‚Äôll answer a few questions that I frequently get from a lot of people I met.

How to start learning or get into the programming field?

Start with the basics. Go with basic C programming or Python first. Understanding what is what is most important than completing the programming language.

How to learn and make software in a week?

Depends on how much you put effort. If you are an experienced programmer already, then you could make things in a week. If you are a beginner then take it slow, set goals complete it intolerable time. It‚Äôs not the end of the world. Isn‚Äôt it?

How many programming languages do you know?

I know a quite few. C, C++, Java, Python, Swift, Ruby, Go, Kotlin, PHP, Javascript, Go lang.

Do you code for 24/7?

No! Not at all. I take my breaks, I code maximum for about 8 hours, the rest of the day I enjoy games, movies and memes.

Suggest me some platform to learn Programming on my own?

  • Youtube (Where i learned most)
  • Sololearn
  • Udacity
  • Udemy
  • Code Academy
  • Coursera

(Links provided, just click to take you there.)

How many days does it take to learn one programming language?

Depends on your understanding and effort. Take me for example, I know the basics and concepts, so all it takes for me is a day or 2, because the base concepts are the same. Only syntax is different. If you are a beginner, it‚Äôll take time.

Are you open to freelancing coz I have a project for you?

I‚Äôm not providing freelance service anymore. If I‚Äôm up for it, ill update it on my social media. follow me for updates.

How can I contact you?

You can drop an email at root@n0nu11.tech, message me in Instagram, tweet/mention me in twitter.

What kind of music do you hear while programming?

Depends, If I am writing a new program I‚Äôll hear beats, high bass, EDM. If I‚Äôm debugging I‚Äôll go with pop music. Totally depends on my mood.

Introvert or Extrovert?

Ambivert üòå

Before you leave

If you have any constructive criticism or any questions, please drop an email at root@n0nu11.tech or ping me in instagram. I‚Äôll be happy to hear your feedback.

Follow me on Github, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn.
